column4: I just installed a package from synaptic that's supposed to give me utilities for my laptop, but I don't know how to access it or modify it
read your package's information provided in synaptic
I did, it didn't provide anything. Also, I restarted and i don't remember what the package is called
then, retrace your steps, what were you looking for and why? All packages have a list of installed files.
it was a set of utilities for dell laptops
I found it in the terminal, then downloaded it through synaptic
so, what do you need help with? Synaptic includes a list of files that each package will install.
well first I need to find the package. Then I need to find what it installed exactly and how I activate it
in terminal, pressing up arrow will step you back through your history of typed commands
I found it in synaptic, but I can't find where It would have installed the program
it may have been a number of programs, look at its file list, it may have put some in /usr/bin or similar
Theres a bunch of files, but I don't know if they're automatically implemented
and I don't really know what to do with any of them
you should do some research through your favourite search engine, not everything comes with the documentation you can easily digest, a certain skill level might be required
Sorry to keep bothering you, but I think I have a grasp at what I have to do. The ReadMe is telling me to make a daemon that starts at boot by creating an init file
and gives me the few things that I have to set, but I don't know how to do it. Do yo uthink you could help me?
I'm off to bed soon, you should do some research through your favourite search engine is my advice
you should check that the init files haven't already been created for you, look in /etc/init.d
thank you for pointing me in the right direction. The readme says I have to create them, I have some basic (read: very basic) programming experience, so might be able to do something
